document_data.caption: Crampons strapped to a pair of arctic boots.
document_data.name: Crampons
document_data.mainbody: '''Crampons''' were a tool designed for the purpose of aiding in the transversal of icy, snowy, and mountainous terrain.
document_data.Description:
Crampons were plates of metal, embedded with spikes and hooks. They were attached to the soles of [[shoe]]s or [[boot]]s, or to the side of [[gauntlet]]s, with several straps of leather.

They were often made of [[steel]] and typically sold in pairs. However, crampons could also be constructed from the supplies found in most [[climbing kit]]s.
document_data.Powers: Attaching crampons to a pair of boots would increase their traction. This improved a wearer's ability to climb up mountainous terrain or walk across icy surfaces. This traction also gave wearers more stable footing on slick and slippery surfaces.
document_data.Notable Users of Crampons:
* Crampons were one of many types of climbing equipment that [[thieves]] were known to utilize.
* On [[Oyaviggaton]], the [[kobold]] servants of [[Arauthator]] were known to wear crampons made from animal teeth on their boots in order to easily traverse the [[white dragon]]'s iceberg lair.
